pull.title: qa: Increase a sync_blocks timeout in pruning.py
pull.body: The last test in `pruning.py` (added in #7871) starts with trying to sync a big chain from one node to a fresh one; this regularly takes more than the default 60 seconds on the machine I use to run all the tests, so I've bumped the timeout on that sync_blocks call to 300 seconds.

events.message: qa: Increase a sync_blocks timeout in pruning.py

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -314,7 +314,7 @@ def wallet_test(self):
         print ("Syncing node 5 to test wallet")
         connect_nodes(self.nodes[0], 5)
         nds = [self.nodes[0], self.nodes[5]]
-        sync_blocks(nds)
+        sync_blocks(nds, timeout=300)
comments.body: Could you pass an increased `wait` here or maybe better yet make sync_blocks calculate a wait based on timeout unless it's explicitly passed.   Otherwise the 1000 lines of the debug log that travis saves quickly fill up.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -314,7 +314,7 @@ def wallet_test(self):
         print ("Syncing node 5 to test wallet")
         connect_nodes(self.nodes[0], 5)
         nds = [self.nodes[0], self.nodes[5]]
-        sync_blocks(nds)
+        sync_blocks(nds, timeout=300)
comments.body: Forgot about that, thanks -- bumped the wait to 5 seconds.  No objection to teaching sync_blocks to be smarter as well, but I'd like this merged asap to get the test suite working again.
